rev.comment: "Reception" seems a much better title than "response"
rev.diff:
Line 776: Line 776:
The release of squeeze (6.0) coincided with the release of [http://www.emdebian.org/grip Emdebian Grip] 2.0 which is a smaller version of Debian squeeze, containing 2,000 packages for 6 architectures. Packages in Emdebian Grip are binary compatible with the same package in Debian.<ref name="emdebian-release-press-2.0">[http://www.emdebian.org/News/2011/20110205.html Emdebian.org]</ref> The cross-built flavour of Emdebian, Emdebian Crush, was not ready for release.
The release of squeeze (6.0) coincided with the release of [http://www.emdebian.org/grip Emdebian Grip] 2.0 which is a smaller version of Debian squeeze, containing 2,000 packages for 6 architectures. Packages in Emdebian Grip are binary compatible with the same package in Debian.<ref name="emdebian-release-press-2.0">[http://www.emdebian.org/News/2011/20110205.html Emdebian.org]</ref> The cross-built flavour of Emdebian, Emdebian Crush, was not ready for release.

==Response==
+
==Reception==
Debian was ranked second only to Ubuntu (which is itself derived from Debian) for ''Most Used Linux Distribution'' for both Personal and Organizational use in a 2007 survey by ''SurveyMonkey.com''.<ref>
Debian was ranked second only to Ubuntu (which is itself derived from Debian) for ''Most Used Linux Distribution'' for both Personal and Organizational use in a 2007 survey by ''SurveyMonkey.com''.<ref>
